item.title: Server announcing
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“Zilent, post:4, topic:331359”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=427715.msg3140928#msg3140928 date=1267500711]100 errors

if(ourPlayer.admin >= 2 && cmd.equals("announce")) { String AdminMessage = ""; long PlayerHash= DataConversions.usernameToHash(args[0]); { AdminMessage = args[0]; showAdminMsg == true; } }//ADD ME
[/quote]

That many errors is almost always caused by a missing bracket. Like the one missing above.[/quote]

You mean the useless bracket he has.

if(ourPlayer.admin >= 2 && cmd.equals(“announce”)) {
String AdminMessage = “”;
long PlayerHash= DataConversions.usernameToHash(args[0]); {
AdminMessage = args[0];
showAdminMsg == true
}

And in this code you have a useless circle bracket

if (showAdminMsg) {
int i9 = 100;
gameGraphics.drawString("#adm#@yel@Server: @whi@" + AdminMessage), 10, i9, 1, 0xffff00);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Server announcing
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Well, i wanted to add server announcing, like RSCA has, i TRIED to do it myself, however, the result was 100 errors :rolleyes: this is what i’ve got so far.

if(ourPlayer.admin >= 2 && cmd.equals("announce")) { String AdminMessage = ""; long PlayerHash= DataConversions.usernameToHash(args[0]); { AdminMessage = args[0]; showAdminMsg == true; }^^^this is client side.^^^

if (showAdminMsg) { int i9 = 100; gameGraphics.drawString("#adm#@yel@Server: @whi@" + AdminMessage), 10, i9, 1, 0xffff00); }

    private boolean showAdminMsg = false;

Anyway, I’m sure its something easily to fix, however, I cant get it, any help?

EDIT: i realised this specific code would only make it to where i could see the announcement. (if the code compiled of coarse)

Read full topic
